text: Michael Davis (1875 – 30 March 1944) was an Irish Cumann na nGaedheal and later Fine Gael politician. He was first elected to Dáil Éireann as a Cumann na nGaedheal Teachta Dála (TD) for the Mayo North constituency at the June 1927 general election. He was re-elected at each subsequent general election until he retired from politics at the 1937 general election. ==References== Category:1875 births Category:1944 deaths Category:Cumann na nGaedheal TDs Category:Fine Gael TDs Category:Members of the 5th Dáil Category:Members of the 6th Dáil Category:Members of the 7th Dáil Category:Members of the 8th Dáil Category:Politicians from County Mayo
title: Michael Davis (Irish politician)
